[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Error handling] [Information leakage] Do the bail!() error messages in get_module, get_package, and verify functions leak sensitive information about package structure or deployment details? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Error handling] [Panic safety] Are all potential panic points (unwrap, expect, array indexing) eliminated or properly handled to prevent DoS via malicious inputs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Error handling] [Error propagation] Does the use of anyhow::Result properly preserve error context through async boundaries, or can errors be silently swallowed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Integration] [Upgrade workflow] When packages are upgraded on-chain with new upgrade_number values, can cached registries become stale and cause old package versions to be used incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Integration] [Multi-package handling] If multiple packages have interdependencies, can the linear iteration through packages cause dependency resolution failures or circular dependency issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Integration] [Bytecode-source sync] Is there a mechanism to ensure bytecode fetched via get_bytecode() matches the source saved via save_package_to_disk(), or can out-of-sync states occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Integration] [Gas implications] Does fetching large numbers of modules with bytecode cause excessive gas usage or rate limiting on the REST API? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Attack: Package substitution] Can an attacker front-run a package deployment by creating a similarly-named package with malicious code, causing verify() to pass but executing different logic? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Attack: Bytecode tampering] During the window between fetching PackageRegistry and fetching individual module bytecode in create(), can an attacker update on-chain modules to inject malicious bytecode? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Attack: Directory pollution] Can an attacker craft package metadata that causes save_package_to_disk() to pollute the filesystem with thousands of .move files in unexpected locations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Attack: Compression ratio abuse] Can an attacker use minimal compression on manifest/source data to bypass size limits but still consume excessive storage after decompression? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Attack: Resource exhaustion] Can an attacker register packages with extremely long names or deeply nested directory structures that cause filesystem exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Edge case: Empty registry] What happens if PackageRegistry.packages is empty - do all operations handle this gracefully or can null pointer/empty collection issues occur? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Edge case: Empty package] Can a package with zero modules cause issues in iteration logic or verification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Edge case: Maximum values] Are u64 upgrade_number values near u64::MAX handled correctly, or can they cause overflow in version comparison logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Edge case: Unicode handling] Are package/module names with emojis, RTL text, zero-width characters, or other complex Unicode properly handled in all string operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Edge case: Path separators] Can module names containing platform-specific path separators (/ or \\) cause cross-platform compatibility issues when saving to disk? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Async: create() race] Can multiple concurrent calls to create() for the same account cause the REST client to make redundant requests or create inconsistent cached states? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Async: get_module() async] Why is get_module() marked async when it only does synchronous iteration - can this cause unnecessary async overhead or confusion? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Async: get_package() async] Similarly, why is get_package() async for a synchronous operation - can this hide concurrency bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Async: get_bytecode() async] The get_bytecode() is async but just does a HashMap lookup - is this future-proofing or does it indicate planned changes that could introduce race conditions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/move_tool/stored_package.rs] [Async: API timeout] Does the REST Client in create() have proper timeout handling, or can slow/malicious API responses cause indefinite hangs? (Medium)
